fact: The Peregrine Falcon is the fastest animal on Earth, reaching speeds of over 240 miles per hour when diving for prey.
Hummingbirds are the only birds that can fly backward and hover in mid-air.
Owls are capable of rotating their heads up to 270 degrees due to their flexible necks and unique anatomy.
The African Grey Parrot is one of the most intelligent bird species, capable of learning hundreds of words and phrases.
The Kiwi bird is the only bird with nostrils at the end of its beak, allowing it to sniff out insects and food underground.
Albatrosses have the longest wingspan of any bird, with some species reaching up to 11 feet from tip to tip.
The Bald Eagle is the national bird and symbol of the United States, representing strength and freedom.
Flamingos are born with gray feathers and gradually turn pink due to their diet, which consists mainly of shrimp and algae.
The Great Horned Owl is known for its distinctive 'horns,' which are actually tufts of feathers on its head.
The Toucan has a large and colorful bill that can reach up to half the length of its body.
